intro: Onosma atrocyanea, commonly known as black-flowered wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, dark blue to black flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Onosma atrocyanea is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes.
